usefulItems: springform cake tin (23 cm), baking paper, refrigerator
title: Raw chocolate beetroot cake

ingredients.content: 2 raw beetroots (approx. 350 g), peeled and cut into pieces (3 cm)
1 orange, zest only, no white pith (optional)
raw beetroot, peeled and spiralized, for garnishing

preparations.content: Grease and line a springform cake tin (23 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place almonds, beetroot, carrot, shredded coconut and orange zest (optional) into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 9<b>.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula. Add psyllium husk, dates, syrup, cacao powder, chia seeds, flaxseeds (linseeds), vanilla and salt and combine <b>25 sec//speed 8<b>, with aid of spatula or until well combined. Transfer into prepared tin and press down evenly using the back of a spoon to form cake base, then place into refrigerator while making icing. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Place cacao butter into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>, then melt <b>3-4 min/37°C/speed 2<b> or until completely melted.
Add cashews, chia seeds, syrup, water, cacao powder and salt and blend <b>40 sec/speed 6<b>.

Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and blend <b>40 sec/speed 6<b> or until smooth and creamy. Pour mixture over cake, smooth with the back of a spoon and place into refrigerator to set until firm (approx. 2 hours). Garnish with spiralized beetroot before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Cut cake into squares and place into the freezer to enjoy as a frozen slice.
You can store this cake in the refrigerator for up to 3 days or in the freezer for up to 1 month.
This recipe was contributed by chef Cynthia Louise.
